channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1893 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1893 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: 'Cattle Cars'
item.description: A view of Michigan Avenue from the viaduct during the World’s Columbian Exposition, 1893, showing people boarding the so-called ‘cattle cars’ to take them to the fir. The first part of the Congress Hotel, the Auditorium and the Studebaker Building (now called Fine Arts Building) and in the distance the statue of Columbus may be seen. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: A Grand Sweep
item.description: Advertisement from Chicago Tribune: July 16, 1893. Other images from this year

item.title: Anarchists Freed
item.description: Chicago Daily Tribune headline/frontpage of Haymarket defendants pardon by Gov. Altgeld. this move effectively ended his career. Source: American News Repository, Duke University Other images from this year

item.title: Anarchists Freed!
item.description: Chicago Daily Tribune, June 27, 1893 headline announcing the overturning of convictions against anarchists from the Haymarket incident. Courtesy of the Chicago Historical Society. Other images from this year

item.description: hicago Tribune: July 11, 1893. Other images from this year

item.description: Chicago Tribune: July 11, 1893. Other images from this year

item.title: Members of the Jury which Tried the Haymarket Anarchists
item.description: Illustration from the front page of the Chicago Tribune, June 27, 1893. Courtesy of American Newspaper Repository, Duke University Libraries Other images from this year

item.title: Nineteen Engines Throw Streams on the Ruins
item.description: Chicago Tribune: July 11, 1893. Other images from this year

item.title: President Grover Cleveland
item.description: President Grover Cleveland delivering his address on the opening day of the World’s Coulmbian Exposition, May 31, 1893. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year
